name: How to Make a Klondike Float
description: It all started with a tweet. FoSE Matt Jacobs shared his genius concept for a Klondike Float last week. We retrieved the supplies (Klondike bar, a can of Coca-Cola, a glass—OK, that's it) and made one. Is it awesomeness in a glass? Yes, yes it is.
recipeIngredient: 1 can cola (We used Coke, but obviously Pepsi or another cola brand will do the trick.)

recipeInstructions.text: Unwrap Klondike bar. Cut into nine pieces (three by three) so they're about ice-cube-sized. The chocolate shell will inevitably shatter into pieces. Making clean, neat cuts is tough, and really when it comes down to it, unnecessary.
Drop about half of the Klondike nuggets into glass. Well, Matt says half, but we embraced our inner fat kids, and went with seven.
Wait a few minutes for the flavors to meld, and super scientific floatification properties to form. Alright, that's long enough. Drink it!
